channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Rodion Shchedrin, Composer Who Captured Russia’s Soul, Dies at 92
item.description: Mr. Shchedrin drew on Russian literature for stage works and was an eager experimenter, inspired by folk tales, religious mysticism and melodrama.

item.title: From devastation to determination: Hurricane Katrina's legacy in pictures
item.description: Hurricane Katrina resulted in nearly 1,400 deaths, according to revised statistics from the National Hurricane Center, and remains the costliest storm...

item.title: Thai Court to Rule on Paetongtarn Shinawatra’s Future in Office
item.description: Paetongtarn Shinawatra is facing a legal challenge that’s seen as an important test of her powerful family’s standing with Thailand’s old guard.

item.title: Appeals Court Declines to Block Trump From Freezing Foreign Aid

item.title: A Tariff Loophole on Cheap Imports Has Closed. How Will It Affect Shoppers?
item.description: The end of the “de minimis” exemption — which allowed packages less than $800 to enter the U.S. tariff-free — is leading to confusion.

item.title: Federal judge says Kari Lake can't fire Voice of America director
item.description: A federal judge has ruled that Trump administration official Kari Lake can't unilaterally fire the director of Voice of America.
